attributes.action: Investigate  whether the result of the EU referendum is legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Two major claims appear to be unfounded. 
1) that we will have £350 million pounds per week available to spend on public services.   In fact the net contribution to the eu is £8.5 billion which is around £165 million  per week. 
2) “Turkey (population 76 million) is joining the EU,”.    In fact Britain (and other countries) has (have) the right of veto in the matter of allowing new countries to have free movement within Europe.
attributes.background: Significant  claims made in the campaign appear to be untrue.

rejection.details:
If you think the result of the referendum should not be viewed as legally binding, you could sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133606
